summary_comment: Professor Dennis offers a rigorous course with extensive reading and writing assignments, requiring students to stay engaged during live Zoom sessions. The class demands consistent participation and comprehension of complex material, though it does not provide explicit teaching of the subject matter. Students must remain attentive at all times and cannot miss classes or fall behind in reading.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dennis offers a rigorous course that demands extensive reading and frequent writing assignments, often exceeding what students are used to. The class format requires constant engagement, with random calls on students during Zoom sessions, and success hinges on the ability to comprehend complex material rather than on direct instruction.

Ratings.comment: Took this class to fill a gen ed credit, now I have more reading and writing assignments per week than I have in my entire life. Must have camera on at all times (zoom class) and cannot be in bed. Calls on people randomly. Reading is very complex and you can succeed in this class if you can comprehend it, but does not actually teach the material.

summary_comment: Professor Palermo is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, earning consistent top ratings from students. Known for his genuine approach, humor, and deep knowledge of the subject matter, he creates an engaging and supportive learning environment. Students praise his dedication and the practical value of his courses, many of which fulfill general education requirements and inspire a desire to explore the topics further.
summary_comment_short: Professor Palermo is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by genuine engagement and a supportive, open classroom environment. Students consistently praise his knowledge, humor, and dedication to their learning, often recommending his classes enthusiastically.

Ratings.comment: Hands down one of the best professors I have ever had. He was very genuine and allowed the class to be open and honest about real topics. I enjoyed the movies we watched just be prepared to do some reading. 7 discussion posts, 1 screening report, 2 short essays (3-4 pgs) and his feedback is great! I would highly recommend any class with him! 10/10
Raphael was a great professor academically and personally! He genuinely cared and always started class with a hilarious story. 10/10 recommend and would take another class with him!!!!

Raphael is the BEST professor I have had at OSU! He's super nice, funny, smart, and really cares for his students, and went wayyy above and beyond what can be expected of a professor just for us. Intro to Brazilian Culture was a blast, took for a GE knowing next to nothing, learned a ton, and now I can't wait until the day I get to visit Brazil!

Favorite class I have ever taken at OSU. 2 short papers, 1 long paper instead of a final exam. Simple readings for every class and a few online discussions. Hilarious dude who really knows his stuff. I took Intro to Brazilian culture and now I want to visit Brazil. This class counted as a global studies GE.

summary_comment: Professor Padgett is an effective and caring educator who employs a flipped classroom model, requiring students to complete most work outside of class through online question submissions and minor reading, while class time is dedicated to discussions. He assigns significant reading but ensures comprehension through ample discussion. Students find his approach engaging and recommend his classes, noting his kindness and the inclusion of a fun surprise like cake at the end of the semester.
summary_comment_short: Professor Padgett is an effective educator who employs a flipped classroom model, requiring students to complete most work outside of class through online question submissions and minor reading, while using class time for discussions. He is highly recommended for his engaging teaching style and commitment to student learning, complemented by additional activities like a cake celebration at the end of the semester.

Ratings.comment: Keith is a really nice, cool teacher. He's very kind and cares a lot about his students. He teaches with a "flipped classroom model," so all of the work (3 online question submissions per week and MINOR reading) is done outside of class and you just have discussions during class. There's a group project. I learned a lot from him and this class.

Good teacher. There's  a lot of reading in the class (3 books and many articles) but there is plenty of discussion so you understand everything. I recommend taking this professor. He also makes cake on the last day of class :)

summary_comment: Professor Younkin's teaching approach is criticized for assigning excessive busy work and requiring extensive writing that could be simplified. Students also find issue with a project that is exclusively accessible to PC users, which they认为是过时的，因为大多数人都使用MAC。教授需要更新教学资源以适应现代技术环境。
summary_comment_short: Professor Younkin's teaching approach is criticized for assigning excessive busy work and requiring extensive writing that could be more succinct. Additionally, the course project is reportedly only accessible to PC users, which is seen as outdated given the prevalence of MAC systems among students.

Ratings.comment: Not a fan of this professor. She assigns busy work, and expects us to write so much for something that could be summed up in a few sentences. Then there is a project that is only available to PC users, in my opinion this is very outdated considering most people now us a MAC. So where would we get this PC? She needs to update and get with the times.
